p: Furthermore, patients with comorbid mental and physical illness may be the most vulnerable to the social and biological effects of the pandemic. Many of these patients are homeless and living in spaces conducive to rapid disease spread [ 15]. Others may not be able to maintain “social distance,” because of reliance on additional outside caretakers and/or because of living in institutional settings. Understanding the needs of our most vulnerable patients and helping to see that those needs are met in safe ways should be a key part of our work during pandemics.
